Key Arguments: The legislation represents an overreach of government control and poses a threat to democracy, free speech, and truth.
The bill is seen as part of a broader trend towards authoritarianism in Australia, alongside other government policies.
The government is positioning itself as the sole arbiter of truth, which is dangerous and indicative of a desire for long-term power and control.
The legislation is perceived as a tool to suppress dissent and manage responses to future policies influenced by global entities like the WEF, WHO, and UN.
The bill undermines foundational rights such as free speech, which have historically contributed to Australia's success and appeal to migrants.
Notable Quotes: This is an attack against thinking Australians and more in line with what we would expect after a communist takeover.
The intention of the government to appoint itself as the sole arbiter of ‘truth’... is a chilling revelation of its true character.
Migrants that we gave refuge to as they fled authoritarian regimes, have been amongst the first to recognise the early signs of authoritarianism appearing here.
